body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

We now have the very convenient ability to navigate backward and forward in an automatically maintained list of the up to 20 most recent locations (directories) via `Set-Location` / `cd`, using the  `-` and `+` `-Path` arguments.

A nice complement to this functionality would be to (a) _list_ the recently visited locations and (b) allow _selecting_ one to revisit _interactively_, say with a `-SelectFromHistory` / `sel` switch:

```powershell
# WISHFUL THINKING
# -SelectFromHistory / -sel presents an interactive menu of the recently visited
# locations to select from, in order to navigate back there.
PS> cd -sel
(1) C:\Users\jdoe
(2) C:\Users\jdoe\Projects
(3) C:\Windows
...
Enter the index of the location to navigate to: 
```

Note: In non-interactive sessions, using this parameter must fail.
title: Add a -SelectFromHistory / -sel switch to Set-Location / cd to allow navigating to a recently visited directory / location by interactive selection from the location history
